Class ReplyTest

java.lang.Object
application.ReplyTest
public class ReplyTest extends Object
JUnit test class for testing reply-related features in a JavaFX QnA-style application. This class validates create, read, update, and delete operations for replies associated with answers to questions in the database. Each test includes console output to help trace the flow of data. Database setup and cleanup are handled automatically before and after each test. Dependencies: - DatabaseHelper.java - Question.java - Answer.java Technologies used: - Java 17+ - JUnit 5 - JDBC (SQL backend)
Author:

  • Method Details

    • setUp

      @BeforeEach public void setUp() throws SQLException
      Sets up the database before each test. Creates a unique question and a parent answer to attach replies to.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if database connection or insertion fails

    • tearDown

      @AfterEach public void tearDown() throws SQLException
      Cleans up all test data from the database after each test. Deletes replies, answers, and the question used in testing.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if cleanup fails

    • testAddReply_Positive

      @Test public void testAddReply_Positive() throws SQLException
      Tests successfully adding a reply to an existing answer.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if database operation fails

    • testAddReply_Negative_EmptyReply

      @Test public void testAddReply_Negative_EmptyReply() throws SQLException
      Tests that attempting to add an empty reply throws a SQLException.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if database operation fails

    • testGetReplies_Positive_MultipleReplies

      @Test public void testGetReplies_Positive_MultipleReplies() throws SQLException
      Tests retrieving multiple replies associated with a single answer.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if database operation fails

      Tests retrieving replies from an answer that has no replies.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if database operation fails

      @Test public void testUpdateReply_Positive() throws SQLException
      Tests updating the content of an existing reply.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if database operation fails

    • testUpdateReply_Negative_EmptyContent

      @Test public void testUpdateReply_Negative_EmptyContent() throws SQLException
      Tests updating a reply to have empty content. Assumes the DB allows this.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if database operation fails

    • testDeleteReply_Positive

      @Test public void testDeleteReply_Positive() throws SQLException
      Tests successfully deleting a reply.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if database operation fails

    • testDeleteReply_Negative_NonExistent

      @Test public void testDeleteReply_Negative_NonExistent() throws SQLException
      Tests attempting to delete a reply that does not exist. Verifies that no exception is thrown and database state remains unchanged.
      Throws:
      SQLException - if database operation fails
